reviews.review_msg: Do not, under any circumstances, take a class with Rita! She does not teach and expects you to learn from the groups youre put into at the beginning of the term. Unfortunately, I had previous experience in Spanish (yes you read that right, unfortunately) because she doesnt like to explain grammar. Marks you wrong because she cant read your writing.

Very inconsistent with instructions and grading. Did not "teach" at all, you were expected to show up to class having done the textbook work and then just talk with peers about it and do the oral group work. Doesn't make sense half the time, just learn her "rules" and obey them at all costs to get the marks

never seen a teacher so mean before.  She likes to embarass students who don't know an answer to something, and she will sit there and wait until they actually come up with an answer, it takes a long time sometimes.  Never taking another spanish class thanks to her!

Sra. Tejeda is very knowledable about Spanish, including grammar, etc. HUGE amounts of homework in SPAN 103: more than I had for any 400-level course. Problem: she admits that her vocab tests are geared towards memorization of weekly words, rather than actual knowledge/learning of Spanish, but won't change them.

Ester was fantastic! Yes, the course was very assignment heavy and you had to be prepared before each class, but as a prof, she was very funny and engaging. She'll call on you to answer questions, which I found kind of nerve wracking  but it really did make me grow! I didn't expect to improve in this course as much as I did. Thanks Ester!
Sometimes she is nice and other times she is really mean. If you son't understand she make you feel bad. Exams are very difficult.

Have her as a coordinator.She is probably the worst coordinator out there. We are currently watching a movie that we have to present about,there is nothing wrong with the movie, the point is that we aren't done with the movie, and she expects us have a presentation about it... Never taking class with her again. She is useless when you email her.

I didn't have Ester as my teacher, but she was the prof who coordinated my class. She was extremely disorganized, her tests were too difficult and explanations of assignments were vague and her e-mails weren't any better. I would not recommend taking any class with her name on it. I went into the year loving Spanish classes and left it hating them.

I took both SPAN 102&103 wih Ester and must say that as a person who have always liked to learn Italian, I never thought I would fall in love with the Spanish language. Ester's excellent attitude and enthusiasm, and her fun-yet-serious approach proved otherwise. She does her best to make sure students have actually learned the material.

This class was the death of me! I also took it as a GPA booster and considered myself to be a master of Spanish. You HAVE to be prepared when you come to this class, you review homework in class and if you don't speak or answer questions you will do poorly. Computer tests were very difficult and quizes every week

she is one of my favourite profs! kind of a quick paced course, and for some she might be a bit hard to understand since she speaks mostly spanish in class. she talks about random subjects(dont worry, in english) and it can go from the locusts to the germans in argentina. overall a great prof. :)

Nice lady but be warned: the grading scheme for Spanish at SFU is nuts. A 70-74 is a C+!! 75-78 is B-!! 79-83 is a B!!! An A is 91-95!! Oh yeah and on top of that the exams are extremely tough. Therefore I will not be doing anymore SPanish courses at SFU. Talk about discouragement!

Lilian is hilarious! You have to get used to her humour and style but once you do you're fine. This class is definitely not for slackers but if you need extra help she is always willing. Ah, she's so damn funny...
Excellent teacher.  Fun class.  Learned a lot.  Totally recommend taking classes with her.
She's one of the best prof i've had in university, always explains things clearly, very patient and a very nice person too~!
She is one of the best teachers I've ever had!!! Bravo Senora!!!
nice lady, want to become part of her family
Loved the class! She's very funny and cares about her students.
she expected way too much

I took SPAN110 with Isabel and loved it! She is very heavy on language immersion, and speaks in Spanish for the majority of class. We had a quiz every other week and regular online activities. Isabel is warm, encouraging, and dedicated. Don't take her classes if you don't care about actually learning the language; she won't tolerate that.

This prof. is absolutely amazing! I was always looking forward to her Spanish class. She is very easy-going, making you feel comfortable during classes. As I am very shy person, feeling comfortable making mistakes in front of others was a big plus. She is also very caring about her students and you can tell she truly enjoys teaching.

This class was soooo much work. Hours and hours every week, much more than any of my other classes. Makes you think twice about taking it online, or taking it with this prof. She seemed less helpful than with the prior semester. Also the oral exam is tons of work for very little percentage. Overall wouldn't recommend this class or this prof.
She is such a friendly and helpful professor, always there to help with questions. The course was very well-organized and fair.
